question: My 12 year old son has been out of school for 2 months.  He has undiagnosed upper right abdominal pain.  His "episodes" of stabbing shooting pain (grade 8.5 ona pain scale) come either 3-6 times a day (lasting 20 -65 minutes) or he can have grade 5-6 pain for 4-6 hours at a stretch... the pain never changes and never radiates to another part of his body.  He also has nausea and blurred vision.  The blurred vision now lasts through out the day.He has had an endoscopy, colonoscopy, and CT scan, Hyda scan, blood work.  He has had ultra sounds.  All negative. He has had stool samples.Also of note, and maybe unconnected, he had a "dark neck" possibly symptomatic of diabetes.  His blood sugars are 27 greater than normal.Has anyone had these symptoms and a diagnosis?Any comments are well appreciated.
title: Right side gastro pain - 2 months no answers
